alert.note: Alert for Hancock; Harrison (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued December 30 at 12:00PM CST until December 30 at 3:00PM CST by NWS New Orleans
info.description: The National Weather Service in New Orleans has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Southeastern Hancock County in southern Mississippi... Southern Harrison County in southern Mississippi... * Until 300 PM CST. * At 1200 PM CST, the public reported thunderstorms producing heavy rain in Multiple roads with water covering them and even a few closed roads around D`Iberville. Between 1.5 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Public reported. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Gulfport, Biloxi, Long Beach, Bay St. Louis, Waveland, Diamondhead, St. Martin, D`iberville, Lyman, Kiln, Shoreline Park, Latimer and Gulfport Airport. This includes the following Interstates... Interstate 10 in Mississippi between mile markers 15 and 47. Interstate 110 in Mississippi near mile marker 1...and between mile markers 3 and 4. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
